Events that occurred on 16 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1920 - Translator Max Schuchart is born.
1934 - Author Diana Wynne Jones is born.
1943 - Actress Sharon Baird is born.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 260.
1974 - Tolkien scholar Corey Olsen is born.
1975 - Mythcon 6 at Scripps College in Claremont, California.
1976 - Mythcon 7 in Sacramento, California.
1981 - The twenty-fourth episode of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1982 - Mythcon 13 at Chapman College in Orange, California.
1984 - The Book of Lost Tales: Part Two is published in the UK.
1992 - The first part of the 1992 radio series of Farmer Giles of Ham is aired on BBC Radio 5.
1992 - Tolkien Centenary Conference, a combination of Oxonmoot 1992 and Mythcon 23, at Keble College, Oxford.
2002 - The Annotated Hobbit (revised edition) is published.
2008 - Mythcon 39 at Central Connecticut State University in New Britain, Connecticut.
2010 - "Edge of the Wild", Tolkien art exhibition in Moreton-in-Marsh, England.
2012 - The Return of the Ring, Tolkien Society conference at Loughborough University, England.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
